replies.msg:
小弟最近操緊英文作文 想請各位巴打指點一下有邊啲地方需要改善

篇文入面啲數據有99.999%都係9up

Should we use nuclear generators as our main source of energy production method

Nuclear reactors are widely used in the whole world for generating electricity. Advanced countries usually have one or more nuclear reactors in their territories, nuclear reactors are very cost-effective and environmentally friendly , but also a sign that technology is improving around the world. In November 2016, there were 450 nuclear generators in action for electricity generating and 60 new generators are being constructed. Nuclear generators can generate tons of electricity very efficiently, but a lot of people disagree with the increasing dosage of radioactive substance over the world due to the harm and danger that it imposes.

There are many advantages of nuclear power generators. First, nuclear generators are one of the most environmentally friendly power generating method. Nuclear reactions will ‘not’ release any pollutants into the atmosphere. (For example, Carbon Dioxide-one of the gases that causes global warming, will not be produced in nuclear reactions) This is the most attractive point of nuclear reactors, as they can generate a lot of energy without emitting a mass amount of pollution. Using coal and oil to generate electricity will make a lot of waste. In the combustion of coal, other than carbon dioxide and sulfur dioxide, there are also Coal Combustion products (CCPs) are produced, for example, fly ash is the main part of all of the CCPs, 60% of the CCPs is fly ashes, although most of the fly ashes are captured and turn into useful construction material-portland cement , some of the fly ashes will escape from the ventilation, and pollute the air. Combustion of oil will also produce sulfur dioxide, which causes acid rain, potentially do a lot of harm to the environment. As nuclear reactors will not make these pollutant, nuclear energy is considered as a clean energy.

Secondly, nuclear generators use Uranium as the fuel. Uranium is a relatively common element in the earth’s crust, which makes it very easy to find. Uranium is usually a by-product in mining for metals and golds, when a company is setting up a mine for metals, they can cooperate with national nuclear plants, and help them to obtain Uranium for their generators, so no extra mines need to be set up and bring harmful effects to the environment to the lowest. Setting up extra mines can lead to a destructive effect to the nearby environment. The process of drilling will produce a lot of waste, such as waste rocks, slags, dirts and tailings. Some of these wastes can be used in various ways, but the geography of the area has already changed, this causes contamination to water bodies of the surrounding of the area, or even landslides if there is a heavy rain due to the loss of soil.

Thirdly, less fossil fuels need to be mined if we use nuclear generators. According to the National Science Foundation in the United States National Academy of Sciences, 1kg of coal can generate 8 kwh of heat, 1kg*(1123 mL) of oil can generate 12 kwh of heat and Uranium can generate 24,000,000 kwh of heat, which is used to generate electricity. Uranium can generate about 2-3 million times more energy than coal and oil in the same proportion (1kg). If there is enough nuclear plants, we can use only nuclear generators to supply our daily electricity needs, and no more other combustion generators need to be used. The process of mining fuels can cause the same environmental problems previously mentioned.

Although nuclear energy seems to be an ideal energy resource to us, it can be extremely dangerous and harmful. Nuclear generators’ core are extremely radioactive -the products of nuclear fission will release alpha particles, beta particles and gamma rays, leakage of gamma rays can cause a massive damage of the environment and human’s health. The damage of nuclear radiations will remain for over thousand of years. For example, the Chernobyl accident- a catastrophic nuclear accident on 26th April, 1986, caused over two hundred thousand people being killed by the shockwaves, radiations and cancers due to the radiation. Chernobyl was a mistake made by humans, but there are also many natural disasters like tsunami, typhoons, earthquakes, which are able to destroy the nuclear plants very easily. We can not control the nature.This was considered as one of the most unstable factors in the risk assessment of building and running a nuclear plant. On 11th March, 2011, the nuclear reactors in Fukushima was destroyed by the tsunami caused by the earthquake undersea, the nuclear waste leaked into the ocean, which led to the deaths of thousands of people and polluted the area with nuclear wastes. Both of these incidents demonstrates how nuclear power can ruin a part of our world in a single day.
Nuclear plants also cost a huge amount of money to set up. Lots of preparation, man-power and materials need to be done and obtained, which cost money, Additionally, they need the approval from the government and get a licence for it, which cost money too. When the company planned to build a reactor, they need to do a massive amount of researches around the area to confirm the area is suitable for building the reactor, as the radiation can have negative effects on the human health, the reactor need to be located in a place that do not have any population in radius of 10 kilometers. This means the nuclear generator must be put in abandoned areas, which cost further more money on building electric tower to transfer electricity to the National Grid. Although nuclear generators can work very cost-effectively now, a lot of people disagree with it.
In addition, nuclear waste is extremely radioactive, their half life is around hundreds of years, the disposal of the nuclear waste is the most severe problem about nuclear generators, and there is no way that we can make the waste become nonradioactive, which causes the social refuse to build more nuclear reactors.

In my opinion, we should use nuclear generators as our main electricity generation method. In theory, nuclear generators can easily take the place of all other energy generating methods, but there are not enough nuclear reactors for replacing all coal/oil generators, because the feudal way of thinking in the society, it makes the massive impression of nuclear energy become impossible and not enough funding provided by the government is also a problem. Money is a very important element in the research, UK government only provide 20 million pounds to support the research of the nuclear energy in 3 years, which is around 1/4000 of the annual funding for nuclear research from the government.

If we want a cleaner and more sustainable electricity generation method, we have to think smarter, development of nuclear energy is impossible if the social keep prejudicing on radioactive substance.

其實大有學問

睇the sense of style或外國社評 就明

不過你應該冇時間，就信自己語感啦

我覺得你已唔錯

怕你太刻意鳩改仲差左啫

感覺好中譯英，同埋要用多d pronouns，淨係nuclear generator/reactor都應該佔左20-30個字。仲未計d咩ccp uranium。

想academic d可以試下將d verb轉noun，例如using nuclear generators改做adoption of nuclear generator，most efficient way of generating electricity改做most efficient way of electricity generation.

最嚴重係，睇完你個intro完全唔知你個立場係咩，又冇成篇文既flow，改卷果個30秒睇一份，邊有時間睇內文，所以intro 同 conclusion 一定要寫得好

http://www.economist.com/news/international/21677243-nuclear-power-emits-no-greenhouse-gases-yet-it-struggling-rich-world-half-death

For your reference

There are many advantages of nuclear power generators. First, nuclear generators are one of the most environmentally friendly power generating method. Nuclear reactions release no air pollutants. (For example, carbon dioxide, one of the greenhouse gases, is not emitted in nuclear reactions) This is the most attractive point of nuclear reactors, as they can generate a lot of energy without polluting the environment. However, fosil fuel power plants produced much waste. In the coal combustion, in addition to carbon dioxide and sulfur dioxide, there are also Coal Combustion products (CCPs), such as fly ash, are also released. FLy ash accounts for 60% of the CCPs. Although most of the fly ashes are captured and turn into useful construction material-portland cement , some of the fly ashes escape from the ventilation, and pollute the air. Combustion of oil will also produces sulfur dioxide, which causes acid rain, to pose a threat to the environment. As nuclear reactors will not make these pollutant, nuclear energy is considered as a clean energy. Therefore, nuclear power is considered as a cleaner alternatve to traditional fossil fuel energy
